name: CartographyInventory
description: The CartographyInventory class provides functionality for interacting with cartography table screens in Minecraft.
overview: It extends the base Inventory class and adds cartography-specific functionality while inheriting all standard inventory operations. This class allows you to automate map cloning, extending, locking, and other cartography operations. The interface consists of three main slots: Map Item Slot (Slot 0), Material Slot (Slot 1), and Output Slot (Slot 2).

constructors.description: Creates a new CartographyInventory instance for the specified cartography table screen. Note: This constructor is primarily used internally by JSMacros. Scripts typically obtain instances through Player.getInventory() or Inventory.create().

methods.name: getMapItem
methods.description: Retrieves the item currently within the Map Item Slot (Slot 0).

methods.name: getMaterial
methods.description: Retrieves the item currently within the Material Slot (Slot 1).

methods.name: getOutput
methods.description: Retrieves the item currently within the Output Slot (Slot 2), representing the result of the cartography operation.
